course.title: Self Host Revolution
course.subtitle: Build software products with AI on your own infrastructure

modules.title: Week 1: The $6 Foundation
modules.description: Set up your own server and deploy your first website

lessons.title: Welcome & What You'll Build
lessons.description: Overview of your 4-week journey to building software products with AI
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Welcome to Self Host Revolution

In this course, you'll learn to build software products using AI as your coding partner. By the end of these 4 weeks, you'll have:

- Your own $6/month server running in the cloud
- A professional course delivery page you built yourself
- The skills to build more products whenever you want

### What We'll Cover

- **Week 1**: Server setup and basic deployment
- **Week 2**: Developer workflow with Git
- **Week 3**: Building the course delivery system
- **Week 4**: Packaging and selling your product

### Prerequisites

- A computer with internet access
- Basic comfort with using a computer
- Willingness to learn and experiment

No prior coding experience required. We'll use AI tools to help us every step of the way.
learning_objectives: Know what you'll build by the end
Set up your workspace for the journey ahead

resources.title: Course Community (Telegram)
resources.description: Join the community for support and accountability

lessons.title: Buying Your VPS
lessons.description: Step-by-step guide to purchasing your $6/month Contabo VPS
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Buying Your VPS

A VPS (Virtual Private Server) is your own computer in the cloud. It runs 24/7 and you can access it from anywhere.

### Why Contabo?

- Best price-to-performance ratio
- $6/month for a capable server
- European company with good privacy
- No surprise billing

### What You'll Get

- 4 vCPU cores
- 6 GB RAM
- 400 GB SSD storage
- Unlimited bandwidth

### Step-by-Step Process

1. Go to contabo.com
2. Select "VPS S" plan
3. Choose your region (closest to you)
4. Select Ubuntu 22.04 as your OS
5. Complete the checkout

**Important**: Save your server IP address and root password - you'll need these next!
learning_objectives: Understand what a VPS is and why you need one

resources.title: Bitwarden Password Manager
resources.description: Free password manager for storing credentials

lessons.title: SSH Keys & First Connection
lessons.description: Generate SSH keys and connect to your server securely
lessons.notes_markdown:
## SSH Keys & First Connection

SSH (Secure Shell) is how you'll communicate with your server. SSH keys are like a super-secure password that proves you are who you say you are.

### Why SSH Keys?

- More secure than passwords
- No need to type passwords each time
- Industry standard for server access

### Generating Your SSH Key

**On Mac/Linux:**
```bash
ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"
```

**On Windows (PowerShell):**
```powershell
ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"
```

### Connecting to Your Server

```bash
ssh root@YOUR_SERVER_IP
```

Replace `YOUR_SERVER_IP` with the IP address from Contabo.

### Using Claude Code to Help

If you get stuck, ask Claude Code:
- "How do I generate an SSH key on Windows?"
- "I'm getting a permission denied error, what do I do?"
learning_objectives: Understand what SSH keys are and why they're important
Generate your own SSH key pair
Connect to your server via SSH
Use Claude Code to troubleshoot connection issues

lessons.title: Domain & SSL Setup
lessons.description: Connect your domain name and secure it with SSL
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Domain & SSL Setup

A domain name is your address on the internet (like joe23.com). SSL (that padlock icon) keeps your site secure.

### Buying a Domain

Recommended registrars:
- Namecheap
- Cloudflare Registrar
- Porkbun

### Pointing Your Domain to Your Server

1. Log into your domain registrar
2. Find DNS settings
3. Create an A record:
   - Name: `@` (or your domain)
   - Value: Your server IP
   - TTL: 3600

### Installing SSL with Certbot

```bash
apt update
apt install certbot
certbot certonly --standalone -d yourdomain.com
```

### Using Nginx

```bash
apt install nginx
```

Claude Code can help generate your Nginx configuration!
learning_objectives: Choose and purchase a domain name
Configure DNS to point to your server
Set up Nginx as your web server

lessons.title: Your First HTML Deploy
lessons.description: Deploy your first website to your new server
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Your First HTML Deploy Time to put something live on the internet! ### Creating Your First Page ```html My First Site

Hello World!

I built this with AI.

``` ### Deploying to Your Server 1. Connect via SSH 2. Navigate to web directory: ```bash cd /var/www/html ``` 3. Create your file: ```bash nano index.html ``` 4. Paste your HTML and save ### Celebrate! Visit your domain in a browser. You just deployed your first website to YOUR server! ### What's Next This manual process works, but next week we'll learn Git - a much better way to deploy code.
learning_objectives: Deploy files to your server via SSH
Verify your site is live on the internet
Understand the basics of web deployment

modules.title: Week 2: Developer Workflow + Git
modules.description: Learn professional development practices with Git and VS Code

lessons.title: VS Code Setup
lessons.description: Configure VS Code for professional development
lessons.notes_markdown:
## VS Code Setup

Visual Studio Code is a free, powerful code editor. It's what most developers use today.

### Installing VS Code

1. Download from code.visualstudio.com
2. Install on your computer
3. Launch VS Code

### Essential Extensions

- **Claude Code** - AI assistant right in your editor
- **Live Server** - Preview changes instantly
- **Prettier** - Auto-format your code
- **GitLens** - Enhanced Git features

### Key Settings

- Enable auto-save
- Set your default terminal
- Configure your theme

### The Power of Claude Code

With Claude Code installed, you can:
- Ask questions about code
- Generate boilerplate
- Debug errors
- Learn as you go
learning_objectives: Add essential extensions including Claude Code
Understand how to use AI assistance in your editor

resources.title: Claude Code Extension
resources.description: AI coding assistant for VS Code

lessons.title: GitHub Basics
lessons.description: Create your GitHub account and understand repositories
lessons.notes_markdown:
## GitHub Basics

GitHub is where developers store and share code. Think of it as Google Drive for code, but with superpowers.

### Creating Your Account

1. Go to github.com
2. Sign up (free account is fine)
3. Verify your email
4. Set up 2FA (two-factor authentication)

### Understanding Repositories

A repository (repo) is like a project folder that:
- Tracks all changes to your files
- Lets you go back to any previous version
- Allows collaboration with others
- Syncs between your computer and the cloud

### Your First Repository

1. Click "New" to create a repo
2. Name it something meaningful
3. Add a README file
4. Make it public or private

### The GitHub Flow

1. Make changes locally
2. Save (commit) your changes
3. Push to GitHub
4. Pull from GitHub to get updates
learning_objectives: Create and secure your GitHub account

lessons.title: Clone, Commit, Push
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Clone, Commit, Push

These three commands are 90% of what you'll use with Git.

### Clone - Get the Code

```bash
git clone https://github.com/username/repo.git
```

This downloads the repository to your computer.

### Commit - Save Your Changes

```bash
git add .
git commit -m "Describe what you changed"
```

A commit is like a save point in a video game.

### Push - Upload to GitHub

```bash
git push
```

This syncs your local commits to GitHub.

### The Full Workflow

1. `git pull` - Get latest changes
2. Make your edits
3. `git add .` - Stage changes
4. `git commit -m "message"` - Save locally
5. `git push` - Upload to GitHub

### When Things Go Wrong

Ask Claude Code! It's excellent at:
- Explaining Git errors
- Suggesting fixes
- Helping you undo mistakes

lessons.title: Git Deployment
lessons.description: Deploy code to your server using Git
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Git Deployment

Instead of manually copying files, we'll set up Git on your server for easy deployments.

### Why Git Deployment?

- One command to deploy
- Easy rollback if something breaks
- Track what's live on your server
- Professional workflow

### Setting Up Your Server

1. SSH into your server
2. Install Git:
   ```bash
   apt install git
   ```
3. Clone your repo:
   ```bash
   cd /var/www
   git clone https://github.com/username/repo.git html
   ```

### Deploying Updates

On your server:
```bash
cd /var/www/html
git pull
```

That's it! Your changes are live.

### The Professional Workflow

1. Edit code locally
2. Test locally
3. Commit and push to GitHub
4. SSH to server and `git pull`

Later, we can automate step 4 with webhooks!
learning_objectives: Set up Git on your server
Know when and how to rollback changes

modules.title: Week 3: The Course Delivery System
modules.description: Build your own professional course delivery page

lessons.title: SPA Architecture Explained
lessons.description: Understand how the course delivery system works
lessons.notes_markdown:
## SPA Architecture Explained

SPA stands for Single Page Application. It means the whole app lives in one HTML file.

### Why SPA?

- Fast loading - no page refreshes
- Smooth user experience
- Simple deployment - just upload files
- No server-side code needed

### How It Works

1. Browser loads `index.html`
2. JavaScript takes over
3. Content changes without page reload
4. URL updates for bookmarking/sharing

### The Architecture

```
index.html          - The main file
â”œâ”€â”€ <head>          - Styles, meta tags
â”œâ”€â”€ <body>          - HTML structure
â””â”€â”€ <script>        - All the JavaScript

course-data.json    - Your course content
```

### Data Flow

1. Page loads
2. JavaScript fetches course-data.json
3. Renders modules and lessons
4. User clicks lesson
5. JavaScript updates the view

No backend server required!
learning_objectives: Understand what a Single Page Application is
Know the advantages of SPA architecture
See how data flows through the application
Grasp why this architecture is perfect for courses

lessons.title: JSON Course Structure
lessons.description: Learn how to structure your course content in JSON
lessons.notes_markdown:
## JSON Course Structure

JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is how we store course data. It's human-readable and easy to edit.

### The Structure

```json
{
  "course": {
    "title": "Your Course Name",
    "subtitle": "A compelling tagline",
    "instructor": "Your Name"
  },
  "modules": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "title": "Module 1: Getting Started",
      "lessons": [
        {
          "id": 101,
          "title": "Welcome",
          "slug": "welcome",
          "video_url": "",
          "status": "coming-soon"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

### Key Fields

- **id**: Unique identifier
- **slug**: URL-friendly name
- **status**: "available" or "coming-soon"
- **video_url**: YouTube, Vimeo, or direct video link
- **notes_markdown**: Lesson content in Markdown

### Editing Tips

- Use a JSON validator to check syntax
- Keep slugs lowercase with hyphens
- Test locally before deploying

lessons.title: Building Live with Claude Code
lessons.description: Watch as we build features using AI assistance
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Building Live with Claude Code

In this lesson, we'll build real features together using Claude Code as our coding partner.

### What We'll Build

- Custom progress tracking
- Video player enhancements
- Mobile menu improvements

### The Process

1. Describe what you want
2. Let Claude Code generate code
3. Review and test
4. Iterate and improve

### Effective Prompting

Good prompt:
> "Add a progress bar that shows percentage of completed lessons. Store completion in localStorage. Use the existing CSS variables for styling."

Better prompt:
> "Add a progress bar showing X of Y lessons complete. When user clicks 'Mark Complete', save to localStorage. Update the progress bar. Match the existing blue color scheme."

### Common Patterns

- Ask for explanations: "Explain how this code works"
- Request modifications: "Make this responsive for mobile"
- Debug together: "I'm getting this error..."
learning_objectives: Use Claude Code effectively for web development
Write better prompts for coding tasks

lessons.title: AI Course Generator
lessons.description: Use AI to generate your complete course outline
lessons.notes_markdown:
## AI Course Generator

Don't start from a blank page! Use AI to generate your course structure.

### The Generator Prompt

Use this prompt with ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI:

```
You are a course curriculum designer. Create a complete course outline for:

**Course Topic:** [YOUR TOPIC]
**Target Audience:** [WHO IS THIS FOR]
**Number of Modules:** [4-8 recommended]
**Lessons per Module:** [3-6 recommended]

For each lesson provide:
- Title and slug
- Description (2-3 sentences)
- Duration estimate
- Notes in Markdown (200-400 words)
- Learning objectives (3-5 points)
- Resources (relevant links)

Output as JSON matching the course-data.json structure.
```

### What You Get

- Complete course structure
- Lesson descriptions for marketing
- Notes ready for recording
- Learning objectives for students

### Customization

1. Generate the base structure
2. Review and adjust
3. Add your personal touches
4. Fill in video URLs as you record
learning_objectives: Use AI to generate course outlines

lessons.title: Customization Workshop
lessons.description: Hands-on session to customize your course page
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Customization Workshop

Time to make the course platform your own!

### What You'll Customize

1. **Colors** - CSS variables in `:root`
2. **Logo** - Replace image URLs
3. **Typography** - Font family and sizes
4. **Layout** - Sidebar position, spacing

### CSS Variables

All colors are in CSS variables:

```css
:root {
    --blue-primary: #0046dd;  /* Main accent */
    --bg-primary: #fafafa;    /* Background */
    --text-primary: #1f2937;  /* Text color */
}
```

### Adding Your Logo

1. Upload your logo files
2. Update the img src in the header
3. Adjust size if needed

### Changing Fonts

1. Get a font from Google Fonts
2. Add the link tag to head
3. Update the font-family in CSS

### Layout Options

- `SIDEBAR_POSITION`: 'left' or 'right'
- `ADVANCED_COURSE_MODE`: true/false
- `DEFAULT_THEME_MODE`: 'light' or 'dark'

modules.title: Week 4: Package & Sell
modules.description: Prepare your course for launch and start selling

lessons.title: Branding Your Page
lessons.description: Create a cohesive brand identity for your course
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Branding Your Page

Good branding builds trust and recognition.

### Brand Elements

1. **Logo** - Simple, memorable
2. **Color Palette** - 2-3 main colors
3. **Typography** - 1-2 fonts max
4. **Voice** - How you communicate

### Creating a Logo

Options:
- Canva (free)
- Looka (AI-generated)
- Fiverr (hire someone)
- Text-only logo

### Color Psychology

- **Blue**: Trust, professionalism
- **Green**: Growth, money
- **Orange**: Energy, creativity
- **Purple**: Premium, wisdom

### Typography Tips

- Sans-serif for modern feel
- Max 2 fonts total
- Headers: Bold, distinctive
- Body: Clean, readable

### Consistency

Use the same:
- Colors across all pages
- Logo placement
- Tone of voice
- Visual style
learning_objectives: Select fonts that match your brand

resources.title: Canva
resources.description: Free design tool for logos and graphics

lessons.title: Payment Integration
lessons.description: Set up ThriveCart or Stripe to accept payments
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Payment Integration

Let's get you ready to accept money!

### Option 1: ThriveCart

**Pros:**
- One-time payment ($495-695)
- No monthly fees
- Built-in affiliate system
- Checkout pages included

**Setup:**
1. Purchase ThriveCart
2. Connect Stripe/PayPal
3. Create product
4. Get checkout link

### Option 2: Stripe Checkout

**Pros:**
- Pay as you go (2.9% + 30c)
- No upfront cost
- Developer-friendly
- Global payments

**Setup:**
1. Create Stripe account
2. Use Payment Links
3. Or integrate with your site

### Protecting Your Content

Options:
- Password-protected page
- Email-gated access
- Member-only hosting
- Third-party membership plugin

### Simple Approach

Start with:
1. ThriveCart checkout page
2. Redirect to unlisted course URL
3. Send URL via email too

lessons.title: Sales Page Basics
lessons.description: Create a compelling sales page for your course
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Sales Page Basics

Your sales page converts visitors into customers.

### The Structure

1. **Headline** - Grab attention
2. **Problem** - What's their pain?
3. **Solution** - Your course
4. **Benefits** - What they get
5. **Proof** - Why trust you?
6. **Offer** - What's included
7. **Price** - The investment
8. **CTA** - Buy now
9. **Guarantee** - Reduce risk
10. **FAQ** - Handle objections

### Headlines That Work

- Promise a specific outcome
- Address their desire
- Create curiosity

Example:
> "Build Your Own $6 Server and Start Selling Digital Products in 4 Weeks"

### Benefits vs Features

**Feature**: "20 video lessons"
**Benefit**: "Master server deployment without the confusion"

### The CTA

- Clear, action-oriented
- Above the fold
- Repeated throughout
- Creates urgency (when appropriate)

resources.title: AI Sales Page Blueprint
resources.description: Bonus training on sales page creation

lessons.title: Launch Checklist
lessons.description: Everything you need to verify before going live
lessons.notes_markdown:
## Launch Checklist

Don't launch until you've checked these off!

### Technical Checks

- [ ] Site loads on mobile
- [ ] All links work
- [ ] Video plays correctly
- [ ] Payment flow works (test purchase)
- [ ] SSL certificate active
- [ ] Page speed acceptable

### Content Checks

- [ ] No typos in headlines
- [ ] All lessons have content
- [ ] Resources links work
- [ ] Course description complete
- [ ] Instructor bio updated

### Marketing Checks

- [ ] Sales page live
- [ ] Email sequence ready
- [ ] Social posts prepared
- [ ] Launch date set
- [ ] Support email working

### Legal Checks

- [ ] Terms of service
- [ ] Privacy policy
- [ ] Refund policy clear
- [ ] Cookie notice (if needed)

### Post-Launch

- [ ] Monitor for issues
- [ ] Check payment notifications
- [ ] Respond to questions
- [ ] Celebrate! ðŸŽ‰

lessons.title: What's Next
lessons.notes_markdown:
## What's Next

Congratulations! You've built something real. Here's where to go from here.

### Immediate Next Steps

1. **Launch your course** - Done is better than perfect
2. **Get feedback** - First students are invaluable
3. **Iterate** - Improve based on feedback
4. **Add content** - More lessons over time

### Growth Opportunities

- **Build in public** - Share your journey
- **Create more products** - You have the skills now
- **Offer services** - Consulting, setup help
- **Build community** - Discord, Telegram, forum

### Technical Upgrades

- Database backend (Supabase)
- User authentication
- Email automation
- Analytics tracking

### Premium Option

Want personalized help? Book a 2-hour co-building session:
- We build your specific idea together
- Live prompting with Claude Code
- Architecture consultation
- Recorded for your reference

### Stay Connected

- Join the Telegram community
- Follow updates and new courses
- Share your wins!

You did it. Now go build something amazing.
learning_objectives: Know when to upgrade technical stack
